objects.name: Attack Flow
objects.description: Extends STIX 2.1 with features to create Attack Flows.

external_references.description: Source code repository for Attack Flow

objects.name: Turla - Snake Emulation Plan
objects.description: The emulation plan, created by the ATT&CK Â® Evaluations team, used during Day 2 of the ATT&CK evaluations Round 5. This scenario focuses on Snake, a rootkit used to compromise computers and exfiltrate data.

objects.name: Turla
objects.description: Russian-based threat group that targets multiple industries in over 45 countries
Attacker has established a watering hole targeting the user

objects.name: Drive-by Compromise
objects.description: Egle browses to a legitimate, but compromised, website and is redirected to a malicious version of the website hosted by the attacker

objects.name: AZUOLAS
objects.description: Windows Workstation

objects.name: mtxcli.dll
objects.description: LightNeuron Companion DLL - malicious companion code; reads the configuration file and loads the email rules; compares email to the rules and routes the emails; establishes email routing back to the C2 server; sends emails to C2 with exfiltrated data embedded in an image

objects.name: JavaScript
objects.description: Multiple snippets of JavaScript are executed in the browser
The browser JavaScript fingerprints the target machine in the background and installs an evercookie

objects.name: Malicious Link
objects.description: The malicious WordPress website prompts the user to update their NotFlash. The user clicks to download the update containing EPIC

objects.name: NFVersion_5e.exe
objects.description: EPIC dropper - Fake updater file that drops an embedded binary and modifies the registry for persistence

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
objects.description: An additional executable is embedded inside NFVersion_5e.exe via the Resource section

objects.name: mxs_installer.exe
objects.description: EPIC Injector - embedded inside in the Resources section of the EPIC dropper; It loads Guard DLL (embedded in its Resource section) and injects it into svchost.exe or explorer.exe depending on privilege level

objects.name: Process Injection
objects.description: NFVersion_5e.exe writes the EPIC Injector to the user's path (indicated by the %TEMP% environment variable) as mxs_installer.exe

objects.name: Winlogon Helper DLL
objects.description: NFVersion_5e.exe modifies a registry key
User logs off and back in to the system, executing the persistence mechanism

objects.name: Embedded Payloads
objects.description: EPIC's guard DLL is embedded inside the resource section of mxs_installer.exe

objects.name: EPIC Guard
objects.description: 2nd stage malware; Guard DLL for the EPIC implant; embedded into the Resource section of the EPIC Injector. At the user level, it searches for an internet-enabled process. Then, it loads an embedded 3rd stage payload from its Resources section and injects it into the process

objects.name: Dynamic-link Library Injection
objects.description: mxs_installer.exe injects EPIC's Guard DLL into explorer.exe

objects.name: Process Discovery
objects.description: explorer.exe enumerates processes looking for internet-enabled processes

objects.name: Embedded Payloads
objects.description: the EPIC worker DLL (the EPIC payload) is embedded in the resource section of the explorer.exe's Guard DLL

objects.name: EPIC worker DLL
objects.description: 3rd stage malware; EPIC payload; It performs various discovery commands, stores the command outputs, obfuscates this information, and sends it to the C2 server via HTTP POST requests.

objects.name: Dynamic-link Library Injection
objects.description: EPIC's worker DLL is injected into msedge.exe

objects.name: svobodaukrayin.ua
objects.description: C2 redirector

objects.name: External Proxy
objects.description: msedge.exe connects to the adversary's compromised proxy over HTTPS protocol

objects.name: System Information Discovery
objects.description: cmd.exe executes discovery commands to learn information about the host computer

objects.name: Domain Groups
objects.description: cmd.exe executes discovery commands to learn information about the domain computers

objects.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
objects.description: msedge.exe downloads gusbsys.exe to the user's desktop

objects.name: gusbsys.exe
objects.description: Snake Installer - executable to setup the Snake rootkit; uses CVE vulnerability and drops gigabit.sys and gusb.sys

objects.name: CVE-2021-1732
objects.description: exploit used by Snake for privilege escalation

objects.name: gusb.sys
objects.description: unsigned Snake driver

objects.name: Windows Service
objects.description: the Snake Installer (gusbsys.exe) drops a vulnerable driver into the Snake directory and then installs it

objects.name: Code Signing Policy Modification
objects.description: the Snake Installer (gusbsys.exe) disables driver signature enforcement (DSE) by loading and exploiting the vulnerable driver

objects.name: Rootkit
objects.description: the Snake Installer (gusbsys.exe) drops the Snake rootkit into the Snake directory and then installs it

objects.name: File Deletion
objects.description: the Snake Installer (gusbsys.exe) removes the vulnerable driver (gigabit.sys) and re-enables DSE

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: the Snake rootkit (gusb.sys) XOR decodes msnsvcx64.dll

objects.name: msnsvcx64.dll
objects.description: Snake's user-mode DLL, embedded in the Snake rootkit; 2 usermodule injections occur -  one with user privileges which is responsible for network communications and another with SYSTEM privileges

objects.abstract: Additional files located in the Snake directory
objects.content:
These files are generated once msnsvcx64.dll is injected into taskhostw.exe and msedge.exe and is running:
svcmon32.sdb -  user-module DLL log file for C2-related logging (heartbeats, beacons, payload downloads, instruction parsing, data uploads)
svcstat64.bin - user-module DLL log file for pipe server logging (when the user module is running in pipe server / c2-comms mode)
udmon32.bin - user-module DLL log file for pipe client logging (when the user module is running in pipe client / execution mode)
dbsvcng64.bin - user-module DLL log file for command execution (process creation, exit codes, command output)

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
objects.description: msnsvcx64.dll is embedded inside the Snake rootkit (gusb.sys)

objects.name: Rootkit
objects.description: the Snake rootkit (gusb.sys) hooks various SYSCALL functions at runtime

objects.name: Event Triggered Execution
objects.description: the Snake rootkit (gusb.sys) registers a Filtering Windows Platform Management (FWPM) Filter

objects.name: Dynamic-link Library Injection
objects.description: the Snake rootkit (gusb.sys) injects msnsvcx64.dll into taskhostw.exe for SYSTEM privileges. This is used to execute tasks received from the C2

objects.name: Symmetric Cryptography
objects.description: msedge.exe XOR encrypts HTTP traffic to bestcafeswimxp2.com

objects.name: bestcafeswimxp2.com
objects.description: C2 redirector
The Snake Installer (gusbsys.exe) successfully elevates privileges to SYSTEM using CVE-2021-1732

objects.name: gigabit.sys
objects.description: signed, vulnerable Gigabyte driver that is used to disable Driver Signing Enforcement
The user browses to a website

objects.name: Dynamic-link Library Injection
objects.description: the Snake rootkit (gusb.sys) injects msnsvcx64.dll into msedge.exe for communications with the C2 over HTTP
The Snake rootkit receives tasking from the C2 server

objects.name: Process Discovery
objects.description: taskhostw.exe receives a command from the C2 and executes the command via CreateProcessW. taskhostw.exe enumerates currently running processes on the local computer

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication
objects.description: taskhostw.exe writes the command output to a named pipe - commsecdev - that msedge.exe reads
The attacker discovers a process running under the user EgleAdmin on the computer

objects.name: Domain Account
objects.description: taskhostw.exe enumerates the EgleAdmin user
Attacker discovers that EgleAdmin is a member of the File Server Admins group

objects.name: Process Discovery
objects.description: taskhostw.exe enumerates a list of running processes on the local machine via CreateToolhelp32Snapshot

objects.name: Token Impersonation/Theft
objects.description: taskhostw.exe duplicates Egle's access token

objects.name: Create Process with Token
objects.description: taskhostw.exe uses CreateProcessWithTokenW to execute net.exe with Egle's access token

objects.name: System Network Connections Discovery
objects.description: taskhostw.exe enumerates a list of shares on the local machine
Attacker discovers the home drive is mapped to a file server

objects.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
objects.description: msedge.exe downloads PsExec and a 2nd Snake Installer to the system32 folder

objects.name: cmu_svc_c2.exe
objects.description: 2nd Snake Installer to setup the Snake rootkit

objects.name: file_svc_mgr.exe
objects.description: PsExec file - used to execute processes on other systems

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication
objects.description: the files are downloaded to a named pipe - commctrldev - that taskhostw.exe reads

objects.name: Domain Accounts
objects.description: taskhostw.exe authenticates as EgleAdmin to gain access to BERZAS

objects.name: BERZAS
objects.description: File Server; Windows Server 2019

objects.name: Service Execution
objects.description: PsExec (file_svc_mgr.exe) executes the Snake Installer (cmu_svc_v2.exe) on BERZAS as EgleAdmin
On BERZAS, msnsvcx64.dll is still injected into taskhostw.exe and msedge.exe

objects.name: Web Protocols
objects.description: msedge.exe connects to cheapinfomedical99.net over HTTP protocol

objects.name: cheapinfomedical99.net
objects.description: C2 redirector

objects.name: File Deletion
objects.description: taskhostw.exe deletes file_svc_mgr.exe and cmu_svc_v2.exe on AZUOLAS

objects.name: PowerShell
objects.description: taskhostw.exe executes powershell.exe to check if the ActiveDirectory PowerShell module is installed

objects.name: Domain Groups
objects.description: taskhostw.exe enumerates Active Directory groups containing the word "management" via Get-ADGroup

objects.name: Domain Groups
objects.description: taskhostw.exe enumerates the usernames of accounts within the Server Management and Domain Admins domain groups via Get-ADGroupMember
Attacker identifies an Active Directory group named Server Management
Attacker identifies ZilvinasAdmin in the list of accounts

objects.name: Domain Account
objects.description: taskhostw.exe enumerates account information via Get-ADUser

objects.name: Remote System Discovery
objects.description: taskhostw.exe enumerates domain computers and their relevant information (IP addresses, DNS names, and description) via Get-ADComputer
Attacker discovers Zilvinas' Workstation on UOSIS

objects.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
objects.description: msedge.exe downloads Mimikatz, PsExec, and a Snake installer to the system32 folder on BERZAS

objects.name: loadperf.exe
objects.description: Mimikatz file; used to dump NTLM hashes from LSASS

objects.name: fs_mgr.exe
objects.description: PsExec file; used to execute processes on remote systems

objects.name: cmu_svc.exe
objects.description: 3rd Snake Installer; used to install the Snake rootkit

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication
objects.description: the files are downloaded to a named pipe - commctrldev - that taskhostw.exe reads

objects.name: LSASS Memory
objects.description: taskhostw.exe dumps credentials using Mimikatz
Attacker discovers the password and NTLM hash for ZilvinasAdmin

objects.name: Pass the Hash
objects.description: taskhostw.exe executes a pass-the-hash attack to authenticate as ZilvinasAdmin on BERZAS

objects.name: Lateral Tool Transfer
objects.description: taskhostw.exe executes PsExec (fs_mgr.exe) to execute the Snake Installer (cmu_svc.exe) on UOSIS

objects.name: UOSIS
objects.description: Windows Workstation

objects.name: Web Protocols
objects.description: msedge.exe connects to gamesiteworldwide2023.org over HTTP protocol
On UOSIS, msnsvcx64.dll is still injected into taskhostw.exe and msedge.exe

objects.name: File Deletion
objects.description: taskhostw.exe deletes Mimikatz (loadperf.exe), PsExec (fs_mgr.exe), and the Snake Installer (cmu_svc.exe) from BERZAS

objects.name: Process Discovery
objects.description: taskhostw.exe enumerates running processes on UOSIS
Attacker discovers processes running under ZilvinasAdmin

objects.name: Domain Account
objects.description: taskhostw.exe creates a new domain admin user using the ZilvinasAdmin access token. Leshy is added to the Domain Admins group. The new user is a backdoor domain admin account for persistence on the domain. However, this scenario does not use Leshy.

objects.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
objects.description: taskhostw.exe downloads and writes LightNeuron files to the system32 folder on UOSIS

objects.name: LightNeuron
objects.description: sophisticated backdoor that targets Microsoft Exchange servers

objects.name: mtxconf.dll
objects.description: LightNeuron Transport Agent DLL - passes emails to the Companion DLL to further analysis; logs date and sender of the email; blocks any emails from the C2 server

objects.name: msiex.ps1
objects.description: PowerShell install script - installs the transport agent

objects.name: perfe009.dat
objects.description: Email rules files - contains the configuration of LightNeuron's email processing behavior

objects.name: wdr.rules.xml
objects.description: Configuration file - contains the configuration of the Companion DLL C2 communications

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication
objects.description: the files are downloaded to a named pipe - commctrldev - that taskhostw.exe reads

objects.name: Lateral Tool Transfer
objects.description: LightNeuron files copied to DREBULE C$ are renamed

objects.name: DREBULE
objects.description: Exchange Server

objects.name: Access Token Manipulation
objects.description: taskhostw.exe uses token impersonation as ZilvinasAdmin to copy files to DREBULE C$

objects.name: Match Legitimate Name or Location
objects.description: winmail.dat masquerades as the file attachment created by Microsoft Outlook when messages are sent from an incorrectly configured mail client

objects.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
objects.description: taskhostw.exe uses WMIC and PowerShell to execute the LightNeuron Transport Installation script (msiex.ps1) on DREBULE, via CreateProcessWithToken,  using a copy of the ZilvinasAdmin token on UOSIS

objects.name: PowerShell
objects.description: cmd.exe executes powershell.exe on DREBULE

objects.name: Transport Agent
objects.description: the LightNeuron Transport Agent is installed on the Exchange Server, masquerading as a benign connection filtering agent - Microsoft.Exchange.Transport.Agent.ConnectionFiltering.dll

objects.name: File Deletion
objects.description: taskhostw.exe deletes msiex.ps1, wdr.rules.xml, mtxconf.dll, mtxcli.dll, perfe009.dat on UOSIS

objects.name: Remote Email Collection
objects.description: EdgeTransport.exe collects and logs all incoming emails for nk.local to a log file in the Temp folder

objects.name: Steganography
objects.description: EdgeTransport.exe reads emails containing JPEG attachments with AES encrypted commands from the C2 server and uses steganography to extract the C2 communications from the attachments

objects.name: Standard Encoding
objects.description: The extracted data is base64 encoded

objects.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
objects.description: EdgeTransport.exe spawns cmd.exe to execute the embedded command from the C2 server

objects.name: Symmetric Cryptography
objects.description: EdgeTransport.exe AES encrypts the command output to be returned to the C2

objects.name: Steganography
objects.description: EdgeTransport.exe uses steganography to embed the C2 communications in a JPEG attachment

objects.name: Standard Encoding
objects.description: the JPEG  is base64 encoded and added as an attachment to a MIME formatted email

objects.name: Mail Protocols
objects.description: EdgeTransport.exe communicates to the C2 server in an email to noreply@innovationmail.net using the .eml file

objects.name: Email Hiding Rules
objects.description: EdgeTransport.exe blocks the delivery of emails that contain C2 communications

objects.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
objects.description: Eventually, when tasked, EdgeTransport.exe exfiltrates the email log file over its existing C2 channel

objects.content: The collected and logged emails will be in the format <user>@nk.local.

This process is the standard name used by the Microsoft Exchange Transport Service. Transport agents are configurable and control how email messages are processed. This process loads the LightNeuron Transport Agent DLL.

objects.description: LightNeuron's Transport Agent passes emails to its Companion DLL (exdbdata.dll) for further analysis
The communications to the C2 server are contained in a .eml file in the C:\Program Files\Microsoft\Exchange Server\V15\TransportRoles\Pickup\ directory

objects.name: Web Protocols
objects.description: msedge.exe sends the command output to the C2 server inside a HTTP request

objects.name: gamesiteworldwide2023.org
objects.description: C2 redirector
Attacker identifies Zilvinas and ZilvinasAdmin

objects.name: Web Protocols
objects.description: connects over the HTTPS protocol
